text: Bhubaneswari Temple is a Hindu temple located in Tripura, India, in Ranagar (55 km from Agartala). Believed to be built in 1660-1675 AD, it is located next to the palace built by Maharaja Govinda Manikya. The temple is mentioned in Rabindranath Tagore’s work. == Architecture == The temple reflects the Charchala style architecture of Bengal. There is a flat raised platform over which the chamber is build with a single arch entrance. There is a curved roof with a finial. == References == Category:Hindu temples in Tripura
title: Bhubaneswari Temple
